intro: Hariota mesembryanthoides, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, adding a vibrant touch to coastal gardens. Hariota mesembryanthoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience to drought conditions.
